title: Question 5:
description: My transaction has been pending on Etherscan for more than an hour. What's the deal and how do I fix this?

fields.title: Answer:
fields.value:
When you Zap liquidity, it normally requires multiple transactions, which you'll be prompted to confirm. However, transactions on Ethereum compete to be confirmed through an auction-like process, bidding by gas price (show as Gwei in your wallet). If the average bidding gas price is much higher than you selected under Speed before Confirming a Zap or when you modified the gas price in MetaMask, your transaction can get stuck. Sometimes we get unlucky choosing a gas price right as gas prices skyrocket (see recommended gas prices at ethgasstation.info).

Transactions submitted by an Ethereum address will processed sequentially so if transaction #1 is stuck, transaction #2 will be stuck waiting until 1 confirms. [Here's](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6EcJNCapRq8&ab_channel=DeFiTutorialswithDeFiDad) a helpful video tutorial from DeFi Dad on how you fix a pending transaction.

fields.title: ​
fields.value: You can also use [this](https://cancel-ethereum-transactions.web.app/) amazing tool to cancel all pending transactions.
